alert.note: Alert for Madison (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 11:55AM CDT until August 10 at 12:15PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL MADISON COUNTY... At 1155 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges measured between 2 to 4 inches of rainfall across Central portions of Madison County from heavy rainfall earlier this morning. Indian Creek at Madison is rapidly rising and is currently at 6 feet. Flood Stage is 7.5 feet. Though it is not expected to reach flood stage, some nuisance or minor flooding is possible in western Madison County for the next few hours. Other river gages in the city of Huntsville are rapidly rising as well, but are not expected to reach flood stage. Additional heavy rainfall may cause additional flooding concerns later today. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Huntsville, Madison, Redstone Arsenal, Gurley, Alabama A And M University, University Of Alabama In Huntsville, Harvest, Ryland, Hampton Cove and Brownsboro. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
